member.name: T:PCSC.CardInsertedEvent
member.summary: A new card has been inserted.

member.name: T:PCSC.CardStatusEventArgs
member.summary: Information about a smart card reader status.

member.name: F:PCSC.CardStatusEventArgs.ReaderName
member.remarks: A human readable string of the reader name.

remarks.para: Is a bit mask containing one or more of the following values:

item.description: The application is unaware of the current state, and would like to know. The use of this value results in an immediate return from state transition monitoring services. This is represented by all bits set to zero.

There is a difference between the state believed by the application, and the state known by the resource manager. When this bit is set, the application may assume a significant state change has occurred on this reader.
The given reader name is not recognized by the resource manager. If this bit is set, then and will also be set
The actual state of this reader is not available. If this bit is set, then all the following bits are clear.
There is no card in the reader. If this bit is set, all the following bits will be clear
There is a card in the reader
The card in the reader is allocated for exclusive use by another application. If this bit is set, will also be set.
The card in the reader is in use by one or more other applications, but may be connected to in shared mode. If this bit is set, will also be set.
There is an unresponsive card in the reader.

member.name: T:PCSC.InvalidParameterException
member.summary: One or more arguments contain invalid parameters.

member.name: T:PCSC.InvalidProtocolException
member.summary: An invalid protocol has been requested.

member.name: T:PCSC.InvalidValueException
member.summary: One or more arguments contain invalid values.

member.name: T:PCSC.ISCardReader
member.summary: Common functions that are needed to operate on Smart Card readers.

member.name: P:PCSC.ISCardReader.ActiveProtocol
member.summary: The currently used protocol to communicate with the card.

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Establishes a temporary exclusive access mode for doing a serie of commands in a transaction.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: You might want to use this when you are selecting a few files and then writing a large file so you can make sure that another application will not change the current file. If another application has a lock on this reader or this application is in there will be no action taken.
This method calls the API function SCardBeginTransaction().

member.name: P:PCSC.ISCardReader.CardHandle
member.summary: A pointer (Card Handle) that can be used for C API calls.

remarks.para: This is the card handle that is returned when calling the C API function SCardConnect().

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.Connect(System.String,PCSC.SCardShareMode,PCSC.SCardProtocol)
member.param: Mode of connection type: exclusive or shared.
member.summary: Establishes a connection to the Smart Card reader.
member.returns:
An error code / return value:
Error codeDescription
Successful (SCARD_S_SUCCESS)
Invalid context handle (SCARD_E_INVALID_HANDLE)
is invalid or (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)
Invalid sharing mode, requested protocol, or reader name (SCARD_E_INVALID_VALUE)
The server is not runing (SCARD_E_NO_SERVICE)
No smart card present (SCARD_E_NO_SMARTCARD)
Could not allocate the desired port (SCARD_E_NOT_READY)
Requested protocol is unknown (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
Could not power up the reader or card (SCARD_E_READER_UNAVAILABLE)
Someone else has exclusive rights (SCARD_E_SHARING_VIOLATION)
The reader name is (SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_READER)
Protocol not supported (SCARD_E_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
An internal consistency check failed (SCARD_F_INTERNAL_ERROR)
Card is not powered (SCARD_W_UNPOWERED_CARD)
Card is mute (SCARD_W_UNRESPONSIVE_CARD)

remarks.para: is a bit mask of acceptable protocols for the connection. You can use ( | ) if you do not have a preferred protocol. The protocol used with this connection will be stored in .
This method calls the API function SCardConnect().

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.Control(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.param: Command to send to the reader.
member.summary: Sends a command directly to the IFD Handler (reader driver) to be processed by the reader.

item.description: is and the IFDHandler is version 2.0 (without ) (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been removed from the reader(SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)

remarks.para: This method is useful for creating client side reader drivers for functions like PIN pads, biometrics, or other extensions to the normal smart card reader that are not normally handled by PC/SC.
This method calls the API function SCardControl().

block.para: The API of this function changed. In pcsc-lite 1.2.0 and before the API was not Windows(R) PC/SC compatible. This has been corrected.

member.name: P:PCSC.ISCardReader.CurrentContext
member.summary: The Smart Card context that will be used for this connection.
member.value: if the reader is not connected.

member.name: P:PCSC.ISCardReader.CurrentShareMode
member.summary: The current mode of connection type: exclusive or shared.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardDisconnect().

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.EndTransaction(PCSC.SCardReaderDisposition)
member.param: Action to be taken on the reader.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: The calling application must be the owner of the previously begun transaction or an error will occur.
This method calls the API function SCardEndTransaction().

block.para: The disposition action is not currently used in PC/SC Lite on UNIX/Linux machines.

member.param:
Mode of connection type: exclusive/shared. ValueDescription
This application will allow others to share the reader. (SCARD_SHARE_SHARED)
This application will NOT allow others to share the reader. (SCARD_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE)
Desired action taken on the card/reader.
member.summary: Reestablishes a connection to a reader that was previously connected to using .
member.returns:
An error code / return value:
Error codeDescription
Successful (SCARD_S_SUCCESS)
Invalid context handle (SCARD_E_INVALID_HANDLE)
is invalid or (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)
Invalid sharing mode, requested protocol, or reader name (SCARD_E_INVALID_VALUE)
The server is not runing (SCARD_E_NO_SERVICE)
No smart card present (SCARD_E_NO_SMARTCARD)
Could not allocate the desired port (SCARD_E_NOT_READY)
Requested protocol is unknown (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
Could not power up the reader or card (SCARD_E_READER_UNAVAILABLE)
Someone else has exclusive rights (SCARD_E_SHARING_VIOLATION)
Protocol not supported (SCARD_E_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
An internal consistency check failed (SCARD_F_INTERNAL_ERROR)
The smart card has been removed (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)
Card is mute (SCARD_W_UNRESPONSIVE_CARD)

remarks.para: is a bit mask of acceptable protocols for the connection. You can use ( | ) if you do not have a preferred protocol. The protocol used with this connection will be stored in .

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.Status(System.String[]@,PCSC.SCardState@,PCSC.SCardProtocol@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Returns the current status of the reader and the connected card.

item.description: The reader object did not allocate enough memory for or for (SCARD_E_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER)
The reader object got invalid. Invalid card handle (SCARD_E_INVALID_HANDLE)
The reader object passed a size of null for or (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The smart card has been removed (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)
The smart card has been reset (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)

remarks.para: The connected readers's friendly name will be stored in . The card's ATR will be stored in . The current state, and protocol will be stored in and respectively.
This method calls the API function SCardStatus().

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.Transmit(System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.param: APDU to send to the card.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: The card responds from the APDU and stores this response in . The buffer must be initialized and will be resized, if the buffer was too big.
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit().

block.para:
This method will only work if the reader has been connected with one of the following protocols:
ProtocolDescription
T=0 active protocol.
T=1 active protocol.
Raw active protocol.

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.Transmit(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.param: APDU to send to the card.
The buffer size of in bytes.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: The card responds from the APDU and stores this response in . The buffer must be initialized. The size of the returned data will be stored in . This method will return with error code if the buffer size of is too small for the result. If the parameter is invalid, the method will throw an .
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit().

block.para:
This method will only work if the reader has been connected with one of the following protocols:
ProtocolDescription
T=0 active protocol.
T=1 active protocol.
Raw active protocol.

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.Transmit(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.param:
A pointer to a pre-defined Structure of Protocol Control Information. You can use one of the following:
Protocol Control InformationDescription
Pre-defined T=0 PCI structure. (SCARD_PCI_T0)
Pre-defined T=1 PCI structure. (SCARD_PCI_T1)
Pre-defined RAW PCI structure. (SCARD_PCI_RAW)
APDU to send to the card.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: The card responds from the APDU and stores this response in .
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit(). The pointers to the pre-defined / built-in PCI structures are determinated with dlsym() on UNIX/Linux hosts and GetProcAddress() on Windows hosts.

member.name: M:PCSC.ISCardReader.Transmit(PCSC.SCardPCI,System.Byte[],PCSC.SCardPCI,System.Byte[]@)
member.param: APDU to send to the card.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: It is recommended to use pre-defined / built-in PCI structures by calling one of the following methods:
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit(). The pointers to the pre-defined / built-in PCI structures are determinated with dlsym() on UNIX/Linux hosts and GetProcAddress() on Windows hosts.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardAttr
member.remarks: Can be used as parameter for the following methods:

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardContext
member.summary: Manages an Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.

member.name: C:PCSC.SCardContext
member.remarks: Each thread of an application shall use its own SCardContext.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels all pending blocking requests on the method.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardCancel().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.CheckValidity
member.summary: Checks the validity of the current context.

remarks.para: Call this function to determine whether a smart card context handle is still valid. After a smart card context handle has been set by , it may become not valid if the resource manager service has been shut down.
This method calls the API function SCardIsValidContext().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.Dispose
member.remarks: If a context to the PC/SC Resource Manager is established, Dispose() will call the method silently.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.Establish(PCSC.SCardScope)
member.param: Scope of the establishment. This can either be a local or remote connection.
member.summary: Creates an Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: Creates an Application Context for a client. This must be the first WinSCard function called in a PC/SC application. Each thread of an application shall use its own .
This method calls the API function SCardEstablishContext().

example.code: SCardContext context = new SCardContext(); context.Establish(SCardScope.System);

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.GetReaderGroups
member.summary: Returns a list of currently available reader groups on the system.
member.returns: An array of s containing all Smart Card reader groups found by the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardListReaderGroups().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.GetReaders
member.summary: Returns a list of currently available readers on the system.
member.returns: An array of s containing all Smart Card readers found by the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardListReaders().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.GetReaders(System.String[])
member.param: List of groups to list readers.
member.summary: Returns a list of currently available readers on the system.
member.returns: An array of s containing all Smart Card readers found by the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: Groups is not used on Linux/UNIX machines using the PC/SC Lite daemon.
This method calls the API function SCardListReaders().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.GetReaderStatus(System.String)
member.returns: A that contains the current reader status.

remarks.para: This method uses the method with a of zero.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.GetReaderStatus(System.String[])
member.summary: Returns the current reader status of all requested readers.
member.returns: An array of s that contains the current reader status of each requested reader.

remarks.para: This method uses the method with a of zero.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.GetStatusChange(System.IntPtr,PCSC.SCardReaderState[])
member.param: Maximum waiting time (in milliseconds) for status change, zero or for infinite.
Structures of readers with current states.
member.summary: Blocks execution until the current availability of the cards in a specific set of readers changes.

returns.para: A indicating an error or the success.The caller receives status changes through the array.

item.description: The user-specified timeout value has expired (SCARD_E_TIMEOUT)

remarks.para: This method receives a structure or list of structures containing reader names. It then blocks for a change in state to occur for a maximum blocking time of or forever if is used.
The new event state will be contained in . A status change might be a card insertion or removal event, a change in ATR, etc.
To wait for a reader event (reader added or removed) you may use the special reader name "\\?PnP?\Notification". If a reader event occurs the state of this reader will change and the bit will be set.
This method calls the API function SCardGetStatusChange().

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardContext.Handle
member.summary: A pointer (Application Context) that can be used for C API calls.
member.value: The returned Application Context handle. Is 0 if not context has been established.

remarks.para: This is the Application Context handle that is returned when calling the C API function SCardEstablishContext().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.IsValid
member.summary: Checks the validity of the current context.

remarks.para: Call this function to determine whether a smart card context handle is still valid. After a smart card context handle has been set by , it may become not valid if the resource manager service has been shut down.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.ReEstablish
member.summary: Re-Establishes an Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager with the last used .
member.remarks: This method must not be called before

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardContext.Release
member.summary: Destroys a communication context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: This must be the last method called in a PC/SC application.
This method calls the API function SCardReleaseContext().

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.BadSeek
member.summary: There was an error trying to set the smart card file object pointer. (SCARD_E_BAD_SEEK)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.Cancelled
member.summary: The action was cancelled by an request. (SCARD_E_CANCELLED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CancelledByUser
member.summary: The user pressed "Cancel" on a Smart Card Selection Dialog. (SCARD_W_CANCELLED_BY_USER)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CantDispose
member.summary: The system could not dispose of the media in the requested manner. (SCARD_E_CANT_DISPOSE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CardNotAuthenticated
member.summary: No PIN was presented to the smart card. (SCARD_W_CARD_NOT_AUTHENTICATED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CardUnsupported
member.summary: The smart card does not meet minimal requirements for support. (SCARD_E_CARD_UNSUPPORTED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CertificateUnavailable
member.summary: The requested certificate could not be obtained. (SCARD_E_CERTIFICATE_UNAVAILABLE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CHVBlocked
member.summary: The card cannot be accessed because the maximum number of PIN entry attempts has been reached. (SCARD_W_CHV_BLOCKED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CommunicationDataLost
member.summary: A communications error with the smart card has been detected. (SCARD_E_COMM_DATA_LOST)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.CommunicationError
member.summary: An internal communications error has been detected. (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.DirectoryNotFound
member.summary: The identified directory does not exist in the smart card. (SCARD_E_DIR_NOT_FOUND)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.DuplicateReader
member.summary: The reader driver did not produce a unique reader name. (SCARD_E_DUPLICATE_READER)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.Eof
member.summary: The end of the smart card file has been reached. (SCARD_W_EOF)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.FileNotFound
member.summary: The identified file does not exist in the smart card. (SCARD_E_FILE_NOT_FOUND)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ICCCreateOrder
member.summary: The requested order of object creation is not supported. (SCARD_E_ICC_CREATEORDER)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ICCInstallation
member.summary: No primary provider can be found for the smart card. (SCARD_E_ICC_INSTALLATION)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.InsertedCard
member.summary: The smart card has been inserted. (Obsolete)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.InsufficientBuffer
member.summary: The data buffer to receive returned data is too small for the returned data. (SCARD_E_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.InvalidAtr
member.summary: An ATR obtained from the registry is not a valid ATR string. (SCARD_E_INVALID_ATR)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.InvalidParameter
member.summary: One or more of the supplied parameters could not be properly interpreted. (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.InvalidTarget
member.summary: Registry startup information is missing or invalid. (SCARD_E_INVALID_TARGET)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.InvalidValue
member.summary: One or more of the supplied parameters values could not be properly interpreted. (SCARD_E_INVALID_VALUE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoAccess
member.summary: Access is denied to this file. (SCARD_E_NO_ACCESS)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoDir
member.summary: The supplied path does not represent a smart card directory. (SCARD_E_NO_DIR)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoFile
member.summary: The supplied path does not represent a smart card file. (SCARD_E_NO_FILE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoKeyContainer
member.summary: The requested key container does not exist on the smart card. (SCARD_E_NO_KEY_CONTAINER)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoMemory
member.summary: Not enough memory available to complete this command. (SCARD_E_NO_MEMORY)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoReadersAvailable
member.summary: Cannot find a smart card reader. (SCARD_E_NO_READERS_AVAILABLE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoService
member.summary: The Smart card resource manager is not running. (SCARD_E_NO_SERVICE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoSmartcard
member.summary: The operation requires a Smart Card, but no Smart Card is currently in the device. (SCARD_E_NO_SMARTCARD)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NoSuchCertificate
member.summary: The requested certificate does not exist. (SCARD_E_NO_SUCH_CERTIFICATE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NotReady
member.summary: The reader or smart card is not ready to accept commands. (SCARD_E_NOT_READY)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.NotTransacted
member.summary: An attempt was made to end a non-existent transaction. (SCARD_E_NOT_TRANSACTED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.PciTooSmall
member.summary: The PCI Receive buffer was too small. (SCARD_E_PCI_TOO_SMALL)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ProtocolMismatch
member.summary: The requested protocols are incompatible with the protocol currently in use with the smart card. (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ReaderUnavailable
member.summary: The specified reader is not currently available for use. (SCARD_E_READER_UNAVAILABLE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ReaderUnsupported
member.summary: The reader driver does not meet minimal requirements for support. (SCARD_E_READER_UNSUPPORTED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.RemovedCard
member.summary: The smart card has been removed, so further communication is not possible. (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ResetCard
member.summary: The smart card has been reset, so any shared state information is invalid. (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.SecurityViolation
member.summary: Access was denied because of a security violation. (SCARD_W_SECURITY_VIOLATION)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ServerTooBusy
member.summary: The Smart Card Resource Manager is too busy to complete this operation. (SCARD_E_SERVER_TOO_BUSY)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.ServiceStopped
member.summary: The Smart card resource manager has shut down. (SCARD_E_SERVICE_STOPPED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.SharingViolation
member.summary: The smart card cannot be accessed because of other connections outstanding. (SCARD_E_SHARING_VIOLATION)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.Shutdown
member.summary: The operation has been aborted to allow the server application to exit. (SCARD_P_SHUTDOWN)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.SystemCancelled
member.summary: The action was cancelled by the system, presumably to log off or shut down. (SCARD_E_SYSTEM_CANCELLED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.Timeout
member.summary: The user-specified timeout value has expired. (SCARD_E_TIMEOUT)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.Unexpected
member.summary: An unexpected card error has occurred. (SCARD_E_UNEXPECTED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.UnknownCard
member.summary: The specified smart card name is not recognized. (SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_CARD)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.UnknownError
member.summary: An internal error has been detected, but the source is unknown. (SCARD_F_UNKNOWN_ERROR)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.UnknownReader
member.summary: The specified reader name is not recognized. (SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_READER)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.UnknownResMng
member.summary: An unrecognized error code was returned from a layered component. (SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MNG)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.UnpoweredCard
member.summary: Power has been removed from the smart card, so that further communication is not possible. (SCARD_W_UNPOWERED_CARD)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.UnresponsiveCard
member.summary: The smart card is not responding to a reset. (SCARD_W_UNRESPONSIVE_CARD)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.UnsupportedCard
member.summary: The reader cannot communicate with the card, due to ATR string configuration conflicts. (SCARD_W_UNSUPPORTED_CARD)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.WaitedTooLong
member.summary: An internal consistency timer has expired. (SCARD_F_WAITED_TOO_LONG)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.WriteTooMany
member.summary: The smart card does not have enough memory to store the information. (SCARD_E_WRITE_TOO_MANY)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardError.WrongCHV
member.summary: The card cannot be accessed because the wrong PIN was presented. (SCARD_W_WRONG_CHV)

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardHelper
member.summary: Helper class that offers methods to convert various values into strings.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardHelper.GetAttrDesc``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns a description string of an enumeration attribute.
member.returns: If available: a description string of the specified attribute. Otherwise null.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardHelper.StringifyError(PCSC.SCardError)
member.summary: Returns a human readable text for the given PC/SC error code.
member.remarks: Warning! This method behaves differently compared to the original PC/SC-Lite pcsc_stringify_error function. Instead of the (const) variable name it returns a short text description.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardMonitor
member.summary: Monitors a Smart Card reader and triggers events on status changes.
member.remarks: Creates a new thread and calls the of the given object.

member.name: C:PCSC.SCardMonitor(PCSC.SCardContext)
member.param: A new Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.
member.summary: Creates a new SCardMonitor object that is able to listen for certain Smart Card / reader changes.
member.remarks: The monitor object should use its own Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager. It will create a (new) backgroud thread that will listen for status changes.

member.name: C:PCSC.SCardMonitor(PCSC.SCardContext,PCSC.SCardScope)
member.param: A new Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.
Scope of the establishment. This can either be a local or remote connection.
member.summary: Creates a new SCardMonitor object that is able to listen for certain Smart Card / reader changes.
member.remarks: The monitor object should use its own Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager. It will create a (new) backgroud thread that will listen for status changes.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardMonitor.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the monitoring of all readers that are currently being monitored.
member.remarks: This will end the monitoring. The method calls the method of its Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.

member.name: E:PCSC.SCardMonitor.CardInserted
member.summary: A new card has been inserted.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardMonitor.GetCurrentState(System.Int32)
member.param: The number of the desired reader. The index must be between 0 and ( - 1).
member.summary: Returns the current state of a reader that is currently being monitored.
member.returns: The current state of reader with index number .
member.remarks: This method will throw an if the specified is invalid. You can enumerate all readers currently monitored with the property.

member.param: The number of the desired reader. The index must be between 0 and ( - 1).
member.summary: Returns the current state of a reader that is currently being monitored.
member.returns: The current state of reader with index number .
member.remarks: This method will throw an if the specified is invalid. You can enumerate all readers currently monitored with the property.

member.param: The number of the desired reader. The index must be between 0 and ( - 1).
member.summary: Returns the reader name of a given .
member.remarks: This method will throw an if the specified is invalid. You can enumerate all readers currently monitored with the property.

member.name: E:PCSC.SCardMonitor.Initialized
member.summary: The monitor object has been initialized.

remarks.para: This event appears only once for each reader after calling or .

member.name: E:PCSC.SCardMonitor.MonitorException
member.summary: An PC/SC error occurred during monitoring.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardMonitor.Monitoring
member.summary: Indicates if there are readers currently monitored.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardMonitor.ReaderCount
member.summary: The number of readers that currently being monitored.
member.value: Return 0 if no reader is being monitored.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardMonitor.ReaderNames
member.summary: All readers that are currently being monitored.
member.value: A array of reader names. if no readers is being monitored.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardMonitor.Start(System.String)
member.param: The Smart Card reader that shall be monitored.
member.summary: Starts to monitor a single Smart Card reader for status changes.

remarks.para:
Do not forget to register for at least one event:
EventDescription
A new card has been inserted.
A card has been removed.
Initial status.
A general status change.
An error occurred.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardMonitor.Start(System.String[])
member.param: A array of reader names that shall be monitored.
member.summary: Starts to monitor a range Smart Card readers for status changes.

remarks.para:
Do not forget to register for at least one event:
EventDescription
A new card has been inserted.
A card has been removed.
Initial status.
A general status change.
An error occurred.
Is a structure containing the following:
The pointers to the pre-defined / built-in PCI structures are determinated with dlsym() on UNIX/Linux hosts and GetProcAddress() on Windows hosts.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardProtocol
member.summary: Communication protocol use with the Smart Card.
member.remarks: This is a bit mask of acceptable protocols for the connection. You can use ( | ) if you do not have a preferred protocol.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardProtocol.Raw
member.summary: Raw active protocol. Use with memory type cards.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardReader
member.summary: Operates on a Smart Card reader.
member.remarks: Implements the most basic PC/SC functions.

member.name: C:PCSC.SCardReader(PCSC.SCardContext)
member.param: Connection context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.
member.summary: Creates a new Smart Card reader object.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardReader.ActiveProtocol
member.summary: The currently used protocol to communicate with the card.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Establishes a temporary exclusive access mode for doing a serie of commands in a transaction.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: You might want to use this when you are selecting a few files and then writing a large file so you can make sure that another application will not change the current file. If another application has a lock on this reader or this application is in there will be no action taken.
This method calls the API function SCardBeginTransaction().

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardReader.CardHandle
member.summary: A pointer (Card Handle) that can be used for C API calls.

remarks.para: This is the card handle that is returned when calling the C API function SCardConnect().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Connect(System.String,PCSC.SCardShareMode,PCSC.SCardProtocol)
member.param: Mode of connection type: exclusive or shared.
member.summary: Establishes a connection to the Smart Card reader.
member.returns:
An error code / return value:
Error codeDescription
Successful (SCARD_S_SUCCESS)
Invalid context handle (SCARD_E_INVALID_HANDLE)
is invalid or (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)
Invalid sharing mode, requested protocol, or reader name (SCARD_E_INVALID_VALUE)
The server is not runing (SCARD_E_NO_SERVICE)
No smart card present (SCARD_E_NO_SMARTCARD)
Could not allocate the desired port (SCARD_E_NOT_READY)
Requested protocol is unknown (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
Could not power up the reader or card (SCARD_E_READER_UNAVAILABLE)
Someone else has exclusive rights (SCARD_E_SHARING_VIOLATION)
The reader name is (SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_READER)
Protocol not supported (SCARD_E_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
An internal consistency check failed (SCARD_F_INTERNAL_ERROR)
Card is not powered (SCARD_W_UNPOWERED_CARD)
Card is mute (SCARD_W_UNRESPONSIVE_CARD)

remarks.para: is a bit mask of acceptable protocols for the connection. You can use ( | ) if you do not have a preferred protocol. The protocol used with this connection will be stored in .
This method calls the API function SCardConnect().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Control(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.param: Command to send to the reader.
member.summary: Sends a command directly to the IFD Handler (reader driver) to be processed by the reader.

item.description: is and the IFDHandler is version 2.0 (without ) (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been removed from the reader(SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)

remarks.para: This method is useful for creating client side reader drivers for functions like PIN pads, biometrics, or other extensions to the normal smart card reader that are not normally handled by PC/SC.
This method calls the API function SCardControl().

block.para: The API of this function changed. In pcsc-lite 1.2.0 and before the API was not Windows(R) PC/SC compatible. This has been corrected.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardReader.CurrentContext
member.summary: The Smart Card context that will be used for this connection.
member.value: if the reader is not connected.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardReader.CurrentShareMode
member.summary: The current mode of connection type: exclusive or shared.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardDisconnect().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.EndTransaction(PCSC.SCardReaderDisposition)
member.param: Action to be taken on the reader.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: The calling application must be the owner of the previously begun transaction or an error will occur.
This method calls the API function SCardEndTransaction().

block.para: The disposition action is not currently used in PC/SC Lite on UNIX/Linux machines.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Status(System.String[]@,PCSC.SCardState@,PCSC.SCardProtocol@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Returns the current status of the reader and the connected card.

item.description: The reader object did not allocate enough memory for or for (SCARD_E_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER)
The reader object got invalid. Invalid card handle (SCARD_E_INVALID_HANDLE)
The reader object passed a size of null for or (SCARD_E_INVALID_PARAMETER)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The smart card has been removed (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)
The smart card has been reset (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)

remarks.para: The connected readers's friendly name will be stored in . The card's ATR will be stored in . The current state, and protocol will be stored in and respectively.
This method calls the API function SCardStatus().

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Transmit(System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.param: APDU to send to the card.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: The card responds from the APDU and stores this response in . The buffer must be initialized and will be resized, if the buffer was too big.
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit().

block.para:
This method will only work if the reader has been connected with one of the following protocols:
ProtocolDescription
T=0 active protocol.
T=1 active protocol.
Raw active protocol.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Transmit(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.param: APDU to send to the card.
The buffer size of in bytes.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: The card responds from the APDU and stores this response in . The buffer must be initialized. The size of the returned data will be stored in . This method will return with error code if the buffer size of is too small for the result. If the parameter is invalid, the method will throw an .
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit().

block.para:
This method will only work if the reader has been connected with one of the following protocols:
ProtocolDescription
T=0 active protocol.
T=1 active protocol.
Raw active protocol.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Transmit(System.IntPtr,System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.param:
A pointer to a pre-defined Structure of Protocol Control Information. You can use one of the following:
Protocol Control InformationDescription
Pre-defined T=0 PCI structure. (SCARD_PCI_T0)
Pre-defined T=1 PCI structure. (SCARD_PCI_T1)
Pre-defined RAW PCI structure. (SCARD_PCI_RAW)
APDU to send to the card.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: The card responds from the APDU and stores this response in .
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit(). The pointers to the pre-defined / built-in PCI structures are determinated with dlsym() on UNIX/Linux hosts and GetProcAddress() on Windows hosts.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Transmit(PCSC.SCardPCI,System.Byte[],PCSC.SCardPCI,System.Byte[]@)
member.param: APDU to send to the card.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: It is recommended to use pre-defined / built-in PCI structures by calling one of the following methods:
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit(). The pointers to the pre-defined / built-in PCI structures are determinated with dlsym() on UNIX/Linux hosts and GetProcAddress() on Windows hosts.

member.name: M:PCSC.SCardReader.Transmit(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.param: APDU to send to the card.
The buffer size of in bytes.
The buffer size of in bytes.
member.summary: Sends an APDU to the smart card that was previously connected by .

item.description: Connect protocol is different than desired (SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH)
An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)
The card has been reset by another application (SCARD_W_RESET_CARD)
The card has been removed from the reader (SCARD_W_REMOVED_CARD)

remarks.para: The card responds from the APDU and stores this response in . The buffer must be initialized. The size of the returned data will be stored in . This method will return with error code if the buffer size of is too small for the result. If one of the parameters or is invalid, the method will throw an .
This method calls the API function SCardTransmit().

block.para:
This method will only work if the reader has been connected with one of the following protocols:
ProtocolDescription
T=0 active protocol.
T=1 active protocol.
Raw active protocol.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardReaderDisposition
member.summary: Action to be taken on the reader.
member.remarks: The disposition action is not currently used in PC/SC Lite.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardReaderState
member.summary: A structures that contains the old and the new Smart Card reader status.

remarks.para: Is used as parameter in .

The new event state will be contained in . A status change might be a card insertion or removal event, a change in ATR, etc.
To wait for a reader event (reader added or removed) you may use the special reader name "\\?PnP?\Notification". If a reader event occurs the state of this reader will change and the bit will be set.

member.name: C:PCSC.SCardReaderState
member.summary: Creates a new Smart Card reader status object.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardReaderState.EventState
member.summary: Reader state after a state change.

member.name: P:PCSC.SCardReaderState.EventStateValue
member.summary: Reader state after a state change.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardScope
member.remarks: The following scopes are not used on Linux/UNIX machines using the PC/SC Lite daemon:

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardScope.System
member.summary: Scope in system. Services on the local machine.

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardShareMode
member.summary: Mode of connection type: exclusive or shared.
member.remarks: can be used before using to send control commands to the reader even if a card is not present in the reader. Contrary to Windows winscard behavior, the reader is accessed in shared mode and not exclusive mode.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardShareMode.Direct
member.summary: Direct control of the reader, even without a card. (SCARD_SHARE_DIRECT)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardShareMode.Exclusive
member.summary: This application will NOT allow others to share the reader. (SCARD_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardShareMode.Shared
member.summary: This application will allow others to share the reader. (SCARD_SHARE_SHARED)

member.name: T:PCSC.SCardState
member.remarks: Is a bit mask that represents the current reader status.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardState.Absent
member.summary: There is no card in the reader.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardState.Negotiable
member.summary: The card has been reset and is awaiting PTS negotiation.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardState.Powered
member.summary: Power is being provided to the card, but the reader driver is unaware of the mode of the card.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardState.Present
member.summary: There is a card in the reader, but it has not been moved into position for use.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardState.Specific
member.summary: The card has been reset and specific communication protocols have been established.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCardState.Swallowed
member.summary: There is a card in the reader in position for use. The card is not powered.

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.ATRMatch
member.summary: There is a card in the reader with an ATR matching one of the target cards. If this bit is set, will also be set. This bit is only returned on the SCardLocateCards() function. (SCARD_STATE_ATRMATCH)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Changed
member.summary: There is a difference between the state believed by the application, and the state known by the resource manager. When this bit is set, the application may assume a significant state change has occurred on this reader. (SCARD_STATE_CHANGED)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Empty
member.summary: There is no card in the reader. If this bit is set, all the following bits will be clear. (SCARD_STATE_EMPTY)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Exclusive
member.summary: The card in the reader is allocated for exclusive use by another application. If this bit is set, will also be set. (SCARD_STATE_EXCLUSIVE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.InUse
member.summary: The card in the reader is in use by one or more other applications, but may be connected to in shared mode. If this bit is set, will also be set. (SCARD_STATE_INUSE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Mute
member.summary: There is an unresponsive card in the reader. (SCARD_STATE_MUTE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Present
member.summary: There is a card in the reader. (SCARD_STATE_PRESENT)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Unavailable
member.summary: The actual state of this reader is not available. If this bit is set, then all the following bits are clear. (SCARD_STATE_UNAVAILABLE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Unaware
member.summary: The application is unaware of the current state, and would like to know. The use of this value results in an immediate return from state transition monitoring services. This is represented by all bits set to zero. (SCARD_STATE_UNAWARE)

member.name: F:PCSC.SCRState.Unknown
member.summary: The given reader name is not recognized by the resource manager. If this bit is set, then and will also be set. (SCARD_STATE_UNKNOWN)

member.name: T:PCSC.StatusChangeEventArgs
member.summary: Information about a smart card reader status change.

member.name: F:PCSC.StatusChangeEventArgs.LastState
member.summary: The reader's status before this event.

remarks.para: Is a bit mask containing one or more of the following values:

item.description: The application is unaware of the current state, and would like to know. The use of this value results in an immediate return from state transition monitoring services. This is represented by all bits set to zero.

There is a difference between the state believed by the application, and the state known by the resource manager. When this bit is set, the application may assume a significant state change has occurred on this reader.
The given reader name is not recognized by the resource manager. If this bit is set, then and will also be set
The actual state of this reader is not available. If this bit is set, then all the following bits are clear.
There is no card in the reader. If this bit is set, all the following bits will be clear
There is a card in the reader
The card in the reader is allocated for exclusive use by another application. If this bit is set, will also be set.
The card in the reader is in use by one or more other applications, but may be connected to in shared mode. If this bit is set, will also be set.
There is an unresponsive card in the reader.

member.name: F:PCSC.StatusChangeEventArgs.NewState
member.summary: The new status of this reader.

remarks.para: Is a bit mask containing one or more of the following values:

item.description: The application is unaware of the current state, and would like to know. The use of this value results in an immediate return from state transition monitoring services. This is represented by all bits set to zero.

There is a difference between the state believed by the application, and the state known by the resource manager. When this bit is set, the application may assume a significant state change has occurred on this reader.
The given reader name is not recognized by the resource manager. If this bit is set, then and will also be set
The actual state of this reader is not available. If this bit is set, then all the following bits are clear.
There is no card in the reader. If this bit is set, all the following bits will be clear
There is a card in the reader
The card in the reader is allocated for exclusive use by another application. If this bit is set, will also be set.
The card in the reader is in use by one or more other applications, but may be connected to in shared mode. If this bit is set, will also be set.
There is an unresponsive card in the reader.

member.name: F:PCSC.StatusChangeEventArgs.ReaderName
member.remarks: A human readable string of the reader name.

member.name: T:PCSC.UnknownReaderException
member.summary: The requested reader name is unknown.
